item.title: Trump Reiterates Call for CNN Divestiture in Media Transaction Discussions
item.description: Top News Trump Reiterates Call for CNN Divestiture in Media Transaction Discussions 9 minutes ago Trump has restated his position that CNN should be sold in any media deal, either as a guaranteed transaction component or through separate sale. He emphasized his consistent view that CNN should be divested alongside other media assets, suggesting a comprehensive approach to media restructuring.

item.title: Hubtown Limited Receives Trading Approval for 21.32 Lakh Equity Shares
item.description: Hubtown Limited Receives Trading Approval for 21.32 Lakh Equity Shares 4 hours ago Hubtown Limited has secured trading approval from both NSE and BSE for 21,31,936 equity shares issued to promoters on preferential basis following warrant conversion. The shares, priced at ₹220 each (₹10 face value plus ₹210 premium), began trading on December 11, 2025, and are subject to a lock-in period until July 31, 2027.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Close in Red, IndiGo Crisis Deepens 11 hours ago Indian stock markets ended negative, with Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex both down 0.32%. Market breadth favored decliners, with 2,382 stocks falling versus 2,166 advancing. IndiGo's operational crisis, Biocon's biologics consolidation, ICICI Bank's stake increase in its AMC, Infosys' Vietnam expansion, and Pine Labs' AI-powered bill pay feature were key highlights. The cautious sentiment was influenced by various corporate developments and global cues.

item.title: Samvardhana Motherson International Completes Acquisition of Remaining 10% Stake in South African Subsidiary
item.description: Samvardhana Motherson International Completes Acquisition of Remaining 10% Stake in South African Subsidiary 4 hours ago Samvardhana Motherson International Limited completed the acquisition of the remaining 10% stake in Motherson Lumen Systems South Africa Pty Ltd on December 10, 2025, through its indirect wholly owned subsidiary Motherson Lumen Holding Ltd. The transaction, which was initially disclosed on December 4, 2025, has resulted in Motherson Lumen SA becoming an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of the company. The completion has been duly reported to stock exchanges in compliance with SEBI regulations, strengthening the company's operational control in the South African market.
